evidence.source_document: Application to Vacate the Order Issued by the U.S. District Court and Request for an Immediate Administrative Stay
evidence.text: Pursuant to Rule 23 of the Rules of this Court and the All Writs Act, 28 U.S.C. 1651, the Acting Solicitor General—on behalf of applicants Scott Bessent, Secretary of the Treasury, et al.—respectfully files this application to vacate the temporary restraining order issued by the U.S. District Court for the District of Columbia (App., infra, 4a-30a).  In addition, the Acting Solicitor General respectfully requests an immediate administrative stay of the district court’s order pending the Court’s consideration of this application

evidence.source_document: Application to Vacate the Order Issued by the U.S. District Court and Request for an Immediate Administrative Stay
evidence.text: Pursuant to Rule 23 of the Rules of this Court and the All Writs Act, 28 U.S.C. 1651, the Acting Solicitor General—on behalf of applicants Scott Bessent, Secretary of the Treasury, et al.—respectfully files this application to vacate the temporary restraining order issued by the U.S. District Court for the District of Columbia (App., infra, 4a-30a).  In addition, the Acting Solicitor General respectfully requests an immediate administrative stay of the district court’s order pending the Court’s consideration of this application

evidence.source_document: Defendants' Motion to Stay the Courts Administrative Stay
evidence.text: Defendants have now appealed the Court’s administrative stay and are requesting an emergency stay pending appeal from the United States Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit

evidence.source_document: Defendants' Motion to Stay the Courts Administrative Stay

extracted.value: Defendant: stay of the court's administrative stay

evidence.source_document: Plaintiff's Cross-Motion for Summary Judgment and Permanent Injunction and in Opposition to the Governments Motion for Summary Judgment
evidence.text: Plaintiff Hampton Dellinger hereby requests, under Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 56, that this Court deny Defendants’ motion for summary judgment, grant Plaintiff’s cross‑motion for summary judgment, and enter declaratory judgment and a permanent injunction in his favor.
